quoteLast: . Suddenly it occurred to him that he would have time to go out and buy some flowers for her. He left his seat, and hurried to the nearest shop in the _Boulevard_.
title: Mademoiselle Blanche: A Novel
author: Barry, John D. (John Daniel), 1866-1942

quoteLast: ; at thirteen minutes to eleven Murchison will set fire to the Columbiad; at that minute precisely we shall leave our spheroid. We have, therefore, still seven-and-twenty minutes to remain upon earth."
title: The Moon-Voyage
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteLast: ," said John, looking at the clock.
title: A Tale of a Lonely Parish
author: Crawford, F. Marion (Francis Marion), 1854-1909

quoteFirst: The steamer _Zent_ was in ballast off the Fastnet when at
quoteLast: on the 6th April, 1916, she was attacked by a submarine. She was struck by a torpedo in the engine-room and immediately afterwards by another in No. 3 hatch on the starboard side.
title: The German pirate
author: Ajax

title: Warren Commission (02 of 26): Hearings Vol. II (of 15)
author: United States. Warren Commission

quoteFirst: —An hour and twenty-five minutes, she said. The right time now is
quoteLast: . The dear knows you might try to be in time for your lectures.
title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
author: Joyce, James, 1882-1941

quoteFirst: The British followed, steaming at fifteen to eighteen knots. The enemy, to their south-east, were easily visible. At
quoteLast: an order for a general chase was signalled. The _Invincible_ and the _Inflexible_ quickly drew to the fore.
title: World's War Events, Vol. I
author: Reynolds, Francis J. (Francis Joseph), 1867-1937 [Editor]; Churchill, Allen L. (Allen Leon), 1873-1940 [Editor]

quoteFirst: 8.15 P.M. The Arabs have still their guns on the river bank, and are firing at the _Husseinyeh_, whom I am trying, by my men, to get off. Evidently they are not cowed, for generally they take their guns back at night to their camp. Report from _Husseinyeh_ steamer:—-
quoteLast: , Wounded, 6; killed, 3; efforts as yet are ineffectual as to taking off the steamer _Husseinyeh_.
title: The Journals of Major-Gen. C. G. Gordon, C.B., at Kartoum.
author: Gordon, Charles George, 1833-1885; Hake, A. Egmont (Alfred Egmont), 1849-1916 [Editor]

quoteLast: . At forty- seven minutes past ten Murchison will launch the electric spark on the wire which communicates with the charge of the Columbiad. At that precise moment we shall leave our spheroid. Thus we still have twenty-seven minutes to remain on the earth.”
title: From the Earth to the moon; and, round the moon
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteLast: ," said John, looking at the clock.
title: A Tale of a Lonely Parish
